domain_description: Hospital operations data including patients, physicians, admissions, and treatments. Key KPIs: patient readmission rate, average length of stay, treatment costs, physician workload, patient satisfaction, mortality rates.

tables.name: physicians
tables.description: Physician information including specialties, experience, and department assignments

columns.physician_id: Unique identifier for each physician (Primary Key)
columns.name: Physician full name

tables.name: patients
tables.description: Patient demographic and medical information including insurance details

columns.patient_id: Unique identifier for each patient (Primary Key)
columns.name: Patient full name

tables.name: admissions
tables.description: Hospital admission records including dates, diagnoses, and readmission tracking

columns.admission_id: Unique identifier for each admission (Primary Key)
columns.patient_id: Foreign key linking to patients table
columns.physician_id: Foreign key linking to physicians table (attending physician)
columns.readmitted: Whether patient was readmitted within 30 days (True/False)

tables.name: treatments
tables.description: Treatment records including procedures, costs, and outcomes for each admission

columns.treatment_id: Unique identifier for each treatment (Primary Key)
columns.admission_id: Foreign key linking to admissions table
columns.treatment_name: Name of treatment or procedure performed

business_questions: What is the readmission rate by physician specialty?
Which treatments have the highest success rates?
How does length of stay vary by diagnosis?
What are the cost patterns for different insurance types?
Which physicians have the highest patient volumes?
